title: Usage Tracking Implementation Status and Features
body: USAGE TRACKING STATUS: âœ… 95% COMPLETE - Phase 0 (feature flags) and Phase 1 (core tracking) fully operational. IMPLEMENTED FEATURES: In-memory usage tracking (usageCount, firstSeenTs, lastUsedAt), debounced persistence (500ms) with immediate flush on first usage, atomic firstSeenTs establishment, graceful shutdown flush (SIGINT/SIGTERM/beforeExit), feature gating via INDEX_FEATURES=usage, persistence to data/usage-snapshot.json. AVAILABLE TOOLS: usage/track (increment usage), usage/hotset (top K by usage+recency), usage/flush (force persistence), feature/status (monitor feature flags). TESTING: Comprehensive test suite covers increment logic, persistence across restarts, feature gating behavior, hotset ordering, and concurrency handling. MINOR REMAINING WORK: Rate limiting per id (~2 hours), performance baseline measurement (~1 hour), optional metadata structure alignment. FUTURE PHASES (not implemented): Phase 2 = temporal windowing (24h/7d buckets), Phase 3 = hotness scoring with decay functions, Phase 4-6 = integrity drift, confidence scoring, adaptive thresholds. Current implementation sufficient for production use with all core functionality operational and fully tested.
